page.title: 11SCHOOLS
page.content:
SCHOOLS
The village has a Church of England primary school and a Special School for severely handicapped children of school age run by Lancashire Education Authority. There are about one hundred children aged between five and eleven at the primary school with three full-time and two part-time teachers. After primary school children travel to secondary schools in Carnforth and Lancaster. Bleasdale House, the special school, is a residential establishment with about twenty residents and slightly more attending on a daily basis.
